oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tandy Rice Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1990 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Tandy Rice. The tape cuts at 3:38 to Tandy Rice giving a speech. The recording takes place on 9-19-90.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tandy Rice
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:06) -- Tandy Rice describes a development idea of an artist he manages, Wendy Holcombe. (2:58) -- Wendy Holcombe enters room, meets Bob Allen. (3:38) -- Tape cuts to Tandy Rice describing his business history. (5:08) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Nashville, TN. (6:15) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the intellectual and financial wealth of Nashville, TN. (7:58) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the history of country music business in Nashville, TN. (10:22) -- Tandy Rice speaks about Barbara Mandrell. (12:12) -- Tandy Rice speaks about country music as a business. (13:01) -- Tandy Rice speaks on the influence of the Grand Ole Opry. (14:11) -- Tandy Rice speaks on the Country Music Association (CMA). (15:35) -- Tandy Rice discusses the emergence of country music on electronic media. (19:24) -- Tandy Rice speaks on diversity in the music business. (20:22) -- Tandy Rice discusses purchasing Top Billing and the history of the company.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rice, Tandy;
